concept.title: Step 2. Run the Command to Set Up MapR
concept.shortdesc: After installing the required client libraries, run the setup-mapr command. The command modifies configuration files, creates the required symbolic links, and installs the appropriate MapR stage libraries. You can run the command in interactive or non-interactive mode.

conbody.p: In interactive mode, the command prompts you for the MapR version and home directory. In non-interactive mode, you define the MapR version and home directory in environment variables before running the command.

In either mode, the command checks if the MapR distribution of Spark is installed in the specified MapR cluster. If a supported version is installed, the command also installs the MapR Spark stage library for you.
